snippet: A sharp dissent held that the drug combination being used in Oklahoma risked causing severe, unconstitutional suffering. But the other five justices voted without comment to deny the appeal for a stay.
abstract: Oklahoma carries out execution of Charles Frederick Warner, who had been sentenced to death for sexually assaulting and murdering an 11-month-old girl in 1997; execution is state's first since it suspended lethal injections following botched April execution of Clayton D Lockett.
lead_paragraph: A sharp dissent held that the drug combination being used in Oklahoma risked causing severe, unconstitutional suffering. But the other five justices voted without comment to deny the appeal for a stay.

headline.main: Oklahoma Executes First Inmate Since Slipshod Injection in April
headline.print_headline: Oklahoma Executes First Inmate Since Slipshod Injection in April
